text: Hey guys, it’s Ro, and….
Welcome to another Nerdy Nummies!

In honor of Metal Gear Solid V coming out,
I thought we should make a treat!

I used to play a lot of Metal Gear Solid III,
and in the game you scavenge

for food. You eat snakes, rats,
frogs, and even Hornets Nests!

So I thought, let’s make a treat that looks
like a delicious
Hornets Nest from the game!
Let’s get started!

To make these Baked Peach Hornets Nests, the
things you will need, will be:

Some fresh peaches, I’ve got four over here,
and then I’ve got ready-made

pie crusts, you can either use ready-made
or use a from scratch recipe,

whatever you’d like, a baking sheet, some
raw turbinado sugar to
sprinkle on top, a pinch of cinnamon.

And then for the sauce on top you’re gonna
need: 1/2 a stick of butter,

1 tablespoon of heavy cream, 1/4 cup of powdered
sugar, and a
tablespoon of honey.
Now let’s put it all together!

The first thing that we’re gonna do is roll
out our dough, and then we’re gonna

cut thin strips, about 1/4 to 1/2 an inch
wide.

After you’ve cut the strips of pie dough
crust, you’re gonna wash your

peaches, and while they’re a little bit
damp we’re gonna wrap them in the crust.

And what I’ve done, is I’ve flipped them
upside down, and you’re gonna start

with the bottom as the top, you’re gonna
take the littlest piece of pie crust,

and what I do, is I just wrap it around the
circle on the top.

And then you’re gonna continue to wrap circles
all the way down,

over-lapping them just a little bit, so that
they’ll look like a nest.

Once your little peach is completely covered,
we’re gonna make the top design,

so you’re just gonna take some of your excess
dough, and I’m just gonna

roll it into a ball. And place it here and
shape it to look like the
top of a nest.

Now we’ve got our little peaches wrapped,
and I’m going to coat them with

a little bit of sugar. So you’re gonna take
a little pinch of sugar,

doo-loo-loo-loo! And I’m just going to sprinkle
them around and press them

into the sides. And then on top you’re just
going to do a very small pinch
of cinnamon. Very small!

I can’t see, am I sprinkling this on the
peach?
Hold on, mmmm!
Ah! I was sprinkling behind the peach!

These little guys are ready, and now you’re
going to heat up your oven to

375, and you’re gonna bake these for about
35 to 40 minutes,

keep your eye on ‘em, awh! Keep your eye
on ‘em!

And when they start to turn a little golden
brown, they’re ready!

While our Peach Hornet Nests are baking, we
are going to make our

butter-cream sauce! The first thing that you’re
going to do is, melt your butter.

So you’re gonna take your butter, put it
in the bowl, and then

I’m gonna heat this up in the microwave
for about 10 seconds.

Now you’re gonna pour in your heavy cream,
powdered sugar, and 1 tablespoon

of honey. And now you’re just gonna whisk
it together, until it’s evenly combined.

Once your Peach Hornet Nests have baked,
we’re gonna give them just a few

minutes to cool. You still want them to be
warm, but you want to be able to pick ‘em up,

and I’ve put them onto a little serving
plate.

And now you’re just gonna take a little
spoon, and we’re gonna drizzle a little
bit of this honey sauce on top.

Ta-da! Here are the Metal Gear Solid Baked
Peach Hornets Nests!

I hope you guys liked them, these were so
much fun to make, and, they’re

super unique! If you like Peach Pie, I think
you will love this recipe!
They are like individual peach pie pockets!

I’m so excited for the new game and I will
be posting lots of pictures on

Facebook, Tumblr, Instagram and Twitter! And
if you guys make these,
please take a picture and send it to me!

I love seeing your baking creations! I just
get a big kick out of it, makes my day!
Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!

Gonna cut me off a little piece! Dee-dee,
dee-dee-doo-doo-doo!
Da-dee-da-dee-dee-dee-dee!
Ohhhhh! Awmh!
Mmmmmm!
Mmmm-mmmm-mmmm!
Snake gives this, two thumbs up and a foot!

As I’m making them, I’m just gonna stick them
over here onto my baking sheet,

I lined it with a peach of… Oops! Peach
of? No! A piece of!
As I’m making these, I’m gonna steak…

Steak? Oh man, every word I’m saying is
a food!
